title: VCU Criterium
description: A fun, fast ~1 mile course with chicanes, sweeping corners, nice pavement, and an uphill drag race sprint.
course:
Markel’s West Creek 
12575 West Creek Parkway, Richmond, VA 23238
registration: Registration opens January 17th at Noon and closes February 21st at 10pm. Day-of registration opens at 7:45am and closes 15 minutes prior to each race.
directions:
From 64 east or west of Richmond: Take exit 175 for VA-288 S toward Chesterfield. In 4.3 miles take 2nd exit onto W Creek Pkwy toward State Route 1250 E. Make the last right before the lake, and your first right from there.

From 95, North of Richmond:  Take 295 N towards Charlottesville, merge onto 64 W, take exit 175 for 288 S toward Chesterfield. In 4.3 miles take 2nd exit onto W Creek Pkwy toward State Route 1250 E. Make the last right before the lake, and your first right from there.

From 95 South of Richmond: take exit 62 for 288 N towards Chesterfield/Powhite Pkwy. In 28.4 miles, take first exit for West Creek Pkwy headed east.  Make the last right before the lake, and your first right from there.

title: Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series
description:
Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series (VAHS  MTB) is Virginia’s official interscholastic mountain bike race series. It is coordinated by Miller School of Albemarle and sanctioned by USA Cycling. The series is open to ANY high school, middle school, or elementary school student in Virginia.

The Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series is held under USA Cycling Permit and is open to any elementary, middle or high school student in the Commonwealth. Each event has a Elementary School (ages 9 & over), J.V. and Varsity race that combines girls and boys categories. Most races are on primarily single-track trails, and most races are multiple-lap events to provide a spectator-friendly experience. Racers do NOT need to be on a school team to participate nor do racers need to have any race experience.

The VAHS MTB Series’ mission is provide a professional and enjoyable interscholastic racing experience for competitors and spectators. For those new to racing, it is an ideal introduction to mountain bike racing. If you like to mountain bike and are considering racing, this is your chance. Sign up for a race! You will have a blast!
course: All races consist of multiple-lap, spectator-friendly courses off varying terrain and technicality. All courses are designed to be fun yet challenging and incorporate mixtures of singletrack, doubletrack, fireroads, and open fields.
registration:
Registration is available online via BikeReg:
https://www.bikereg.com/net/virginia-high-school-mountain-bike-series

Day-of registration is also available for all categories. Registration closes 30 minutes prior to scheduled start time.
directions:
Directions and addresses to each of the race locations can be found on the event website:
http://vahsmtb.org/2014-schedule/

address.street: Dismal Swamp Canal Trail, Old Route 17

12 Hours of Lodi Farm
description: A 12 Hour Cross Country mtb race from 10 am until 10 pm. The team/solo with the most laps wins. All categories race for prize table. Awards will be given 3 deep in all categories.
course: FUN Tight, windy, old-school single track with some hills. A 10 mile loop.
registration: Online Registration is open until the Wednesday before race day. Race day registration is available from 7 AM until 9:45 AM. For fees, go to www.fredevents.org and find the 12 Hours of Lodi page.
directions: The race is held on the private property of the Grigg family on Hollywood Farm Road in Fredericksburg, VA 22405. When you get off of Rte 3 onto Hollywood Farm Rd. (Rte 601), make a right turn after 1/2 mile IMMEDIATELY before the train tracks and follow the signs to the race venue down a gravel road.

title: 2014 Air Force Association Cycling Classic-Challenge Ride
Jamestown Gran Fondo
description:
The Jamestown Gran Fondo is ideally situated in the heart of Virginia's Historic Triangle. This beautiful ride rapidly takes you on to low traffic, country roads where the pavement is nice and the hills are small. With staggered starts everyone can finish and enjoy BBQ and beer by the water next to the Jamestown Settlement. Don't miss out on this wonderful time of year to be in Williamsburg, VA.

The Jamestown Gran Fondo has Century, Metric Century and 30 mile options. Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations. The Century starts at 7:30AM, the Metric Century at 8:30AM, and the 30 miler at 9AM. Each of these rides is mostly flat but has some long, gradual climbs (max 125 ft). The post ride party starts at 11:30AM and goes until 4:00PM. Riders get 2 beers and a BBQ plate with their entry with more available for purchase.

All registered cyclists get the following: finishers medal, short sleeve technical shirt, cycling socks, well supported and well stocked stations on the route and access to the post ride party along with beer and BBQ

Remember, this is a supported ride, not a race! All riders are expected to obey all traffic laws, ride single file, and stay to the right as much as possible.

title: The Battle on the Ridge
description:
You're in for a treat when you race this course. Most people don't expect it - the trail is technical with plenty of hills, log hops, and turns - AWESOME riding. The trail system is accessible any time - if you don't know where to go, check out the map of the Quarry Trails on www.fambe.org. Be aware that Fall Hill Ave. is closed due to construction. For trail closings due to weather, check out www.fatmug.org.

This race is part of the  Virginia Off-Road Series and also part of the VA MTB Series. There are prime perks that come along with the race: FREE Ts (guaranteed to pre-registered racers until we run out, so REGISTER EARLY), food, drink (includes brew), and a most definitely AWESOME atmosphere. And it's a given that the man to stack the Schwag table is no other than local Eric Squirrel Robinson, NEW owner of The Bike Stop. If you are in need of anything pre- or post race, make sure to stop by the store!
registration:
Beginner registration is at the registration tent from 7:00 to 8:45 sharp.

Registration for all other categories starts at 9:00 and closes at 10:45 sharp.
directions:
RACE START located at: The BOTTOM of Wicklow Dr. Fredericksburg, 22401

Coming North/South on I-95: Take Exit 130 to Culpeper. Stay in right lane and make right into Central Park (Central Park Blvd.). Stay on Blvd. until you pass Wal-Mart on your left. Make a right on Fall Hill Ave. (you'll see Sheetz across the street). Travel ~1/2 Mile, cross I-95 until you see a 7-11 on your left. At the light, make a left onto Wicklow Drive. Follow until you drive into a baseball stadium parking lot. Follow the parking volunteers' directions once you see one.

Coming West on Rt. 3: Cross over I-95 and make right into Central Park. Follow directions above.

Coming East on Rt. 3: Go past Mall Entrance and make left into Central Park (at the big sign). If you cross I-95 you went too far.

title: The Chesapeake Criterium and the Virginia age-graded State Championshi
Training Ride - Alpine Loop Gran Fondo / Shenandoah Mountain Adventure
description:
Get Ready to Climb!

Created in response to the request of 'Fondo participants, this road cycling event will help ready riders for the Alpine Loop and Shenandoah Mountain Adventure routes of the 2014 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo.

Jeremiah Bishop will lead the ride with assistance from other Harrisonburg-based professional cyclists. The ride will be fully supported with cycling snacks, a variety of sports drinks and water, fruit, sag vehicles, a picnic lunch and training Q&A following.

This training ride is a great opportunity for you to get a glimpse of some steeps climbs and dirt roads of the 2014 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. It's timed to provide a great training boost in preparation for the Gran Fondo. If you can't participate in the 'Fondo, this ride is a great adventure in and of itself!

Participants should come prepared for the ride with their bicycle in great working order. All riders should bring at least two water bottles, and carry at least one spare tube, CO2 cartridge or preferably a pump, multi-tool and identification. Cycling equipment should be suitable for the conditions - Alpine Loop riders will encounter steep un-paved roads; Shenandoah Mountain Adventure riders will stay on entirely paved surfaces. All riders should be prepared for changing weather conditions - spare clothing and rain gear can be stowed in the SAG vehicles.
course:
Riders who are training for the Alpine Loop should be prepared to ride 85 miles with 7,000+ feet of climbing - one of the mountain climbs is on unpaved steep surfaces. The Route includes the "Dark Side" climb up Shenandoah Mountain from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride.


Riders who are training for the Shenandoah Mountain Adventure should be prepared for a 65 mile ride with 6,000-feet of climbing on paved mountain climbs. Route will include the climb up Shenandoah Mountain's Moyers Gap Road from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride.

After a warmup through the Valley, the ride will make its way up some great mountain roads. The first climb will treat participants to spectacular scenery. We will divide into two groups which will be based on participants' desired ride length; and ultimate training goals - Alpine Loop or Shenandoah Mountain Adventure. Throughout the ride, you'll have access to full support from SAG vehicles and enjoy the guidance and expertise of local cycling pro's and seasoned Alpine guides.

At the ride's completion, you'll be treated to lunch, relax, recover and enjoy discussing training tips and preparation for the Alpine Loop and Shenandoah Mountain Adventure with Jeremiah and other professional cyclists.

title: Farm Bureau Turkey Run Cross Weekend by Fat Frogs
Alpine Loop Gran Fondo
description: Hosted by professional cyclist Jeremiah Bishop, the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo is an event to welcome cyclists and spectators to Harrisonburg, Virginia for an exciting weekend of special events, challenging rides, charity fundraising and festivities for the entire family.
course:
http://alpineloopgranfondo.com/routes/
The Shenandoah Mountain Adventure and the Valley View Challenge take place on almost-entirely paved surfaces. Riders who participate in these routes will enjoy just a few brief connectors on little dirt roads, over low-water bridges and up country lanes. These  short connectors make the experience all the better – and riders won’t need any event-specific equipment to prepare for the road surfaces. Riders in the Shenandoah Mountain Adventure will want to be prepared with appropriate gearing for the smooth, paved mountain climbs.
The Alpine Loop is a completely different challenge. Throughout its 105 miles, the Alpine Loop route features over 11,000 feet of climbing including the smooth paved climb on Virginia Route 33 and two incredible mountainous dirt roads.

The dirt climbs are what make the Alpine Loop the unique challenge that it is. If you talk with previous years finishers, you’re sure to hear amazing stories of how they tested their limits, cursed the mountain, rose to the challenge, forged new friendships and made some of their best memories right here on the dirt of the Alpine Loop.

For more information about the routes, visit: http://alpineloopgranfondo.com/information/dirt-tires-gears/

The Alpine Loop Gran Fondo is held under Special Use Permit from the USDA Forest Service, North River Ranger District.
registration:
https://www.bikereg.com/Net/22084
ENTRY INCLUDES:
104, 75 and 35-MILE ROUTE OPTIONS
FULLY STOCKED REST STOPS with OSMO HYDRATION STATIONS (DETAILS)
FULLY CATERED FINISH LINE FESTIVAL
LIVE MUSIC
 ELECTRONIC TIMING START-TO-FINISH, KOM SEGMENTS
5-YEAR AGE GROUP KOM/QOM COMPETITION (104, 75-MILE ROUTES)
PROSTATE CANCER AWARENESS PROJECT KOM JERSEYS AWARDED TO AGE 5-YEAR AGE GROUP WINNERS
FREE HOT SHOWERS AT FINISH LINE
ON-SITE PARKING
PREMIUM FINISHER TOKENS:
VALLEY VIEW CHALLENGE FINISHERS RECEIVE MEDALLIONS ON 2014 FINISHER RIBBONS
SHENANDOAH MOUNTAIN ADVENTURE FINISHERS RECEIVE MEDALLION ON 2014 FINISHERS RIBBON
ALPINE LOOP FINISHERS WHO COMPLETE RIDE BY 6 P.M. RECEIVE HANDMADE BRASS SWISS GLOCKEN (BELL) ON 2014 FINISHER RIBBON
ALPINE LOOP RIDERS WHO COMPLETE THE RIDE AFTER 6 P.M. RECEIVE MEDALLION ON 2014 FINISHER RIBBON
notes:
SPECTATORS AND FAMILIES CAN PURCHASE OPTIONAL FESTIVAL PASS TO ACCESS CATERING TENT - IN ADVANCE ONLY.


NEW BELGIUM BREWING BEER GARDEN TO SUPPORT SHENANDOAH VALLEY BICYCLE COALITION.
CASH WILL BE ACCEPTED ON-SITE IN BEER GARDEN.

LUCAS COFFEE ROASTERS MOBILE COFFEE SHOP WILL BE ONSITE AT THE START LINE, ACCEPTING CASH AND CREDIT CARDS.

YOU WILL NEED TO PRESENT AN ID AT ON-SITE SIGN-IN AND TO VERIFY AGE TO ACCESS THE BEER GARDEN*
ALL RIDERS ARE ASKED TO CARRY IDENTIFICATION ON THEM DURING THE RIDE - STATE ISSUE PHOTO IDs or "ROAD ID" SUGGESTED
directions:
The Start and Finish Line Festival are located at the Turner Pavilion, 228 S. Liberty Street, Harrisonburg, Virginia.
The parade-style start of the Gran Fondo will take place on South Main Street between Warren Street and Court Square. The Finish Line Festival will be held in the Turner Pavilion and adjacent greenspace.
View the map below, for important locations for the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo, Cycling Capital Celebration, Host Hotel and local bike shops:
http://alpineloopgranfondo.com/information/your-visit/

title: Gran Fondo Virginia
description:
The Gran Fondo Virginia will explore the rolling hills, lush scenery and vineyards of Albemarle County, Virginia - birthplace and home of U.S. Presidents Thomas Jefferson and James Monroe. 

Starting and finishing at Walnut Creek Park, just south of Charlottesville, the GFV offers three courses that suit every level of cyclist: from the approachable (and reasonably flat) 22-mile Piccolo Fondo, to the hilly 71-mile Medio Fondo and the challenging 101-mile Gran Fondo that serves up 6,500 ft. of climbing over the many short,steep hills of southern and eastern Albemarle County.

Route Timing, Neutral Technical Support, Rest Stops featuring local produce and a post-ride party will all contribute to what is sure to become another enduring Virginia tradition!
course: Three route choices of 22, 71 and 101 miles in length are offered. The longer two routes feature a timed climb section. All riders will also receive a finish time.
registration:
Online registration may be completed at the following link: 
https://sport-vista.sportngin.com/register/form/073651423

Event day registration will also be held at the start/finish location (Walnut Creek Park) from 6:30 to 8:15 AM. A $10 late fee will apply.
notes:
Start and Finish and Packet Pick-Up/Registration will be held at Walnut Creek Park, 8 miles south of Charlottesville. Packet pick-up and race-day registrations are held in the pavilion at the beach area. Participant parking and start/finish are adjacent to the pavilion (see map below).

Packet Pick-Up and Registration will be held from 6:30 to 8:15 AM at the pavilion at Walnut Creek Park. Saturday evening packet-up may be held as well - details to follow.

Parking is at the north lot near the beach area and pavilion at Walnut Creek Park. Signage and marshals will be present.
directions:
Directions to Walnut Creek Park:
From Washington D.C, and points north: Take U.S. 29 south to Charlottesville. Take the U.S. 29 Bypass South toward Lynchburg. Proceed 4 miles to I-64. Take I-64 East toward Richmond. After 2 miles, take the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). Take a right at the end of the ramp onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left. 

From points west: Take I-64 to Charlottesville. Take the second Charlottesville exit, which is the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). At the end of the ramp, take a right onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left.

From Richmond/points east: Take I-64 to the third Charlottesville exit, which is the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). At the end of the ramp, take a left onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left.

From Lynchburg/points south: Take U.S, 29 north to the town of North Garden. Make a right turn onto VA 712/Plank Rd. (at the Crossroads Store). Proceed 4.5 miles on Plank Rd. and make a left turn onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd.). Proceed 2.6 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the right.

For GPS routing, use "Walnut Creek Park, North Garden, VA"
